The College of Sorbonne (French: Collge de Sorbonne) was a theological 
college of the University of Paris, founded in 1253 by Robert de Sorbon (1201
1274), after whom it was named. With the rest of the Paris colleges, it was 
suppressed during the French ... In 1470, the Sorbonne had one of the first 
printing presses in France.
